<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N984048.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24157651.273270353;dc_trk_aid=468725156;dc_trk_cid=132385868;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="WeWork" style="width:100%;max-width: 114px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="114" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8yNTIvMTU4OTQ4MDUwMS1XZVdvcmtfbG9nb190cmFuc3BhcmVudC1ibGFjay5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>If you’re new to the Brew, on Saturdays we’ve been hitting pause on the news cycle to tackle <em>really </em>big-picture topics, from the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/24/future-cities" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">future of cities</a> to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/08/virtual-worlds-stay" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual economies</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today’s theme was chosen mainly because it’s been the first thing brought up in every conversation over the past three months: Is remote work our destiny?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before we dive in, we’ll get you caught up on yesterday’s headlines.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REMOTE WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/employers-consider-remote-opportunities-work-postpandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Can We Work From Home...Forever?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Empty office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84OC9lbXB0eV9vZmZpY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remote work has grown on corporate executives like a hot bowl of cauliflower gnocchi. They held off on principle for years, but one bite suddenly turned into 20, and many are now considering making the switch permanent.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What have we learned a few months into the Great WFH Experiment? <strong style="color:#000">It's been a pleasant surprise.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to <a href="https://content-static.upwork.com/blog/uploads/sites/6/2020/05/26131624/Upwork_EconomistReport_FWR_052020.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an Upwork survey</a>...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>56% of hiring managers think it’s gone better than expected, and one-third said productivity has increased (less than a third said it decreased). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>62% plan to offer more remote work going forward. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not just management that's pleased. Three-fifths of U.S. workers who are working from home because of the pandemic <a href="https://news.gallup.com/poll/306695/workers-discovering-affinity-remote-work.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">want to stay remote</a>, according to Gallup.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pros:</strong></span><span> No commute, fewer meetings, no more listening to your deskmate talk about their weekend. Mid-day Peloton rides.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Cons: </strong></span><span>Tech issues, home distractions (kids), communication barriers, less inter-team contact. Plus, many workers are putting in three extra hours a day and having trouble separating work from their personal lives.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those were a lot of drawbacks...but some experts think they can be mitigated.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>“What we’re experiencing now isn’t truly intentional remote work, it’s crisis-induced work from home,” Darren Murph, head of remote at GitLab, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-many-remote-work-is-becoming-permanent-in-wake-of-coronavirus-11590100453?mod=hp_minor_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>. Companies who move forward with remote work can spend more time putting infrastructure in place to support their employees. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The hard truths </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The traditional office wasn’t exactly perfect before this. And remote work has its own pain points.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Access:</strong> Working from home is far easier for knowledge workers and higher earners. Black and Hispanic/Latino workers are disproportionately <a href="https://www.epi.org/blog/black-and-hispanic-workers-are-much-less-likely-to-be-able-to-work-from-home/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">left out</a> of remote opportunities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Equity:</strong> The gender pay gap among full-time remote workers has <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90484420/theres-a-massive-pay-gap-between-men-and-women-who-work-from-home?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">widened</a> over the last six years, according to Owl Labs. And during the pandemic, women have <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/05/08/women-take-on-more-their-kids-remote-learning-responsibilities/5178659002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">continued</a> to shoulder a greater portion of “invisible labor” like childcare, housekeeping, and shopping. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Trust: </strong>If employers don’t trust workers to work when they're remote, it can increase burnout and hurt morale. A boom in <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/05/13/854014403/your-boss-is-watching-you-work-from-home-boom-leads-to-more-surveillance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">employee surveillance</a>, from screen capturing tech to logs of keyboard strokes, has accompanied the recent WFH experiment. Privacy advocates fear this could normalize surveillance.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COST SAVINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/remote-work-major-cost-saver?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Benefit of Remote Work: Follow the Money
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A rebuilt city" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTEvYV9yZWJ1aWx0X2NpdHkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pivoting to remote can be like having a small wedding. You tell people it was for high-minded reasons, but…you probably also saved some $$$. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re not saying your boss doesn’t care about your work-life balance, just that she also cares about not covering your three kombucha/day habit. According to a <a href="https://globalworkplaceanalytics.com/telecommuting-statistics?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Global Workplace Analytics report</a>, the typical firm can save an average of $11,000 per half-time telecommuter per year. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where do those savings come from? </h2>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Real estate and related costs. </strong></span><span>Rafat Ali, CEO of travel publisher Skift, </span><span><a href="https://www.foliomag.com/skift-going-remote-outside-furloughs-staff-news-notes/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Folio</a></span><span> the firm will save $600,000/year by not renewing the lease on its Manhattan office (it made over $10 million in rev. in 2018). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Reduced payroll.</strong></span><span> When Mark Zuckerberg </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/21/facebook-joins-accelerating-trend-toward-permanent-remote-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolled out</a></span><span> Facebook’s new long-term remote policy this month, he indicated that employees who leave Silicon Valley will also bid farewell to their Silicon Valley salaries. </span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then again, Zuckerberg said Facebook wouldn’t necessarily save money from going more remote because it'll incur other expenses, such as occasionally bringing employees back to HQ for "onsites." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then again again, he probably knew not to say, “We’re doing this because money.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The research still isn’t 100% conclusive, but there’s some evidence remote work boosts productivity, engagement, and retention, which can indirectly pad companies' bottom lines.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SECONDARY EFFECTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/secondary-consequences-remote-work?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Long Sweatpants, Short the Big Apple
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There are the <em>obvious</em> consequences of a larger portion of the workforce working from home. Some are less obvious. We compiled a few under-the-radar effects that might not immediately come to mind. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shared workspaces will gain: </strong>During non-pandemic times, don’t expect “remote work” to necessarily mean “work from home.” People will flock to shared workspaces like coffee shops in order to be <em>near </em>other people while they work—something that hasn’t been a possibility given closures of nonessential businesses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Athleisure boom</strong>: The apparel category was growing before the pandemic, but without meetings, offices, or networking events to attend, growth has been supercharged. Shares of athleisure poster child Lululemon <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-21/lululemon-hits-record-on-high-hopes-for-athleisure-trend?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soared</a> to all-time highs this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Geographic dispersal: </strong>Office is gone from midtown NYC? So am I. Expect workers to settle in warmer-weather cities with a lower cost of living. On the employer side, not requiring that workers relocate to a physical office may open up new opportunities to find top talent on the cheap. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shake-up in podcasting: </strong>When Spotify scooped up Joe Rogan for $100 million, it knew it was gaining more than an audio product—Rogan’s also a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/9/20801873/youtube-podcast-creators-h3-joe-rogan-ethan-klein-hila-david-dobrik-views?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">video superstar</a>. With fewer commuters listening to podcasts in cars and trains, we’ll likely see more activity in the audio/video hybrid space Spotify and others are now investing in. <strong style="color:#000"> </strong></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY WEWORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Offices Are Changing, But How?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N984048.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24157651.273270353;dc_trk_aid=468725156;dc_trk_cid=132385868;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="WeWork" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvNzQ2LzE1OTA2NzUzNjYtV2V3b3JrX0JyYW5kZWRDb250ZW50X1ByaW1hcnlfdjIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Are you at home, far away from your coworkers, living half of your life on a video conference call? Us too. And to be honest, we’re ready to be back with the Crew in one place again. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So in that spirit, we <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N984048.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24157651.273270353;dc_trk_aid=468725156;dc_trk_cid=132385868;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worked with the office innovators at WeWork to put together a discussion guide</a> that’s all about <strong style="color:#000">navigating the future of work</strong>. Over the next few weeks, we’ll be covering everything you need to know to get back into the office. Step one, find an actual pair of pants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N984048.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24157651.273270353;dc_trk_aid=468725156;dc_trk_cid=132385868;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first part of our guide</a>, we’re discussing what distancing means for your company and how your space will need to adapt. Here’s a hint: More distance, more signage, more communication.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So take a read of our first piece right here, and be on the lookout for more <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N984048.3407870MORNINGBREW/B24157651.273270353;dc_trk_aid=468725156;dc_trk_cid=132385868;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">office-based content</a> in the coming days.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SMALL TALK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/office-small-talk-waste-time-irreplaceable-idea-pipeline?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Miss Talking About the Weather?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Small talk " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5t9tmFbNcGbVVTLRGi/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Small talk " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5t9tmFbNcGbVVTLRGi/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oscar Wilde <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/feb/20/conversations-last-refuge-the-art-and-heart-of-talking-about-the-weather?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">once dissed</a> conversations about the weather as “the last refuge of the unimaginative.” But considering idle chit chat around the watercooler all but evaporates in remote work arrangements, it's worth asking: Is there any value in discussing last night's <em>Survivor </em>episode with a coworker? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Many business leaders hail chance conversations as essential</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Silicon Valley can trace its pro-small talk mentality back to Intel, which laid out its workspaces to make sure employees bumped into each other like molecules. According to biographer Walter Isaacson, Steve Jobs <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/20141007161621-73685339-why-steve-jobs-obsessed-about-office-design-and-yes-bathroom-locations/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">designed</a> Pixar’s HQ with a central “atrium” for gathering—and even positioned the bathrooms to encourage spontaneous employee interaction. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Jobs later planned Apple’s new headquarters to consist of a ring of open workspaces surrounding a courtyard.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s the point?</strong> The argument can be summed up in a <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/marissa-mayer-defends-her-work-from-home-ban-2013-4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2013 memo</a> sent by Yahoo’s former CEO Marissa Mayer: “People are more collaborative and innovative when they’re together.” She was defending her ban on employees working from home. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Can Slack and Zoom replace small talk?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Possibly. But creating the kind of cross-team rapport you get from impromptu brainstorms and avoiding eye contact in the bathroom mirror is like using a whisk instead of an electric mixer. WFH experts like Stanford professor Nicholas Bloom say it’s definitely possible, but takes effort. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bloom <a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/3/20/21187469/work-from-home-coronavirus-productivity-mental-health-nicholas-bloom?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Recode</a> that employees should have the following videoconferences every. single. day: 1) A half-hour group chat to talk about anything and everything <em>except</em> work and 2) 10-minute chats between bosses and direct reports.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PERSONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/brews-managing-editor-reflects-working-home?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reflections on Working From Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wayfair Home Office" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84Mzgvd2F5ZmFpcl9ob21lX29mZmljZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.wayfair.com/shop-the-look/slp/-foundstone-photo-id449715" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Wayfair</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is Neal Freyman, the managing editor of Morning Brew. With our company completely remote since March 11, I thought you might be interested to hear what the experience has been like for the Brew writers.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There’s been no disruption in our day-to-day: </strong>All our team <em>really</em> needs to write newsletters is a strong wi-fi connection and the steady drip of coffee. Not only have we managed to publish our existing schedule of newsletters without any problem, we’ve added one publication already during the pandemic (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Essentials</a>) and are planning to launch another newsletter in a few weeks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But I don’t talk to other teams much. </strong>I think this is one of the biggest differences between working in an office and WFH—I interact with few others beyond the editorial team and the leadership team. I used to talk to the hilarious folks in our sales department every day when grabbing something from the office refrigerator, but I haven’t spoken to most of them in months. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So while things seem to be going smoothly...</strong>I don’t know what we’re missing out on. Which face-to-face conversations would’ve led to the next big idea? Would morale be higher if our company formed a kickball team? How much better would the Brew’s newsletters be if we could discuss our issues in-person? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I don’t have the answer. But I, for one, am ready to get back to the office ASAP.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Disclaimer: The home office in this image looks nothing like mine. </em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Samsung and Gemini take crypto to the next level</strong>. Samsung Blockchain Wallet will partner with <a href="https://gemini.com/samsung?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=samsung_launch&utm_content=sponsorship" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gemini</a>, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, to enable users to buy, sell, and trade crypto through their Samsung devices. Learn more <a href="https://gemini.com/samsung?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=samsung_launch&utm_content=sponsorship" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As if she couldn’t be any more impressive.</strong> On <a href="http://www.pbs.org/wnet/amanpour-and-company/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=amanpourandconewsletter&utm_content=brewsbets" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Amanpour and Company</a>, Christiane Amanpour leads in-depth conversations with global thought leaders and cultural influencers on issues impacting the world in politics, tech, business, and the arts. Watch <a href="http://www.pbs.org/wnet/amanpour-and-company/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=amanpourandconewsletter&utm_content=brewsbets" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend conversation starters</strong>...for when it's 9pm and still light out:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Should you </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/iearnengiish/status/1266300285124657153?s=12" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ever use</a></span><span> the word “very” in your writing? (More style tips </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/28/morning-brew-style-blog-3-finally-nail-one-word" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a></span><span>.)</span>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMinneapolis update: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA former Minneapolis police officer who pressed his knee on the neck of George Floyd, a black man who later died in police custody, was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/e27cfce9464809aa8c91afd74c930bb5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earrested\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and charged with murder yesterday. Protests over Floyd’s death have engulfed Minneapolis and spread across the nation this week.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGeopolitics: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump made a flurry of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/29/trump-taking-action-to-eliminate-special-treatment-for-hong-kong.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebig announcements\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e regarding China yesterday, including revoking Hong Kong's preferential trade status and ending the U.S.' support for the World Health Organization.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThis is one confusing economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConsumer spending \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-consumer-spending-fell-record-april-personal-savings-jumped-coronavirus-2020-5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped 13.6%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in April—the most on record. At the same time, household incomes and personal savings posted record increases. That’s the government stimulus payments kicking in.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nREMOTE WORK \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/29/employers-consider-remote-opportunities-work-postpandemic?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCan We Work From Home...Forever?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Empty office\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84OC9lbXB0eV9vZmZpY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemote work has grown on corporate executives like a hot bowl of cauliflower gnocchi. They held off on principle for years, but one bite suddenly turned into 20, and many are now considering making the switch permanent.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat have we learned a few months into the Great WFH Experiment? \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt's been a pleasant surprise.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to \u003ca href=\"https://content-static.upwork.com/blog/uploads/sites/6/2020/05/26131624/Upwork_EconomistReport_FWR_052020.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ean Upwork survey\u003c/a\u003e...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e56% of hiring managers think it’s gone better than expected, and one-third said productivity has increased (less than a third said it decreased). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e62% plan to offer more remote work going forward. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not just management that's pleased. Three-fifths of U.S. workers who are working from home because of the pandemic \u003ca href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/306695/workers-discovering-affinity-remote-work.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewant to stay remote\u003c/a\u003e, according to Gallup.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePros:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e No commute, fewer meetings, no more listening to your deskmate talk about their weekend. Mid-day Peloton rides.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCons: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTech issues, home distractions (kids), communication barriers, less inter-team contact. Plus, many workers are putting in three extra hours a day and having trouble separating work from their personal lives.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose were a lot of drawbacks...but some experts think they can be mitigated.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e“What we’re experiencing now isn’t truly intentional remote work, it’s crisis-induced work from home,” Darren Murph, head of remote at GitLab, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-many-remote-work-is-becoming-permanent-in-wake-of-coronavirus-11590100453?mod=hp_minor_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. Companies who move forward with remote work can spend more time putting infrastructure in place to support their employees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe hard truths \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe traditional office wasn’t exactly perfect before this. And remote work has its own pain points.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAccess:\u003c/strong\u003e Working from home is far easier for knowledge workers and higher earners. Black and Hispanic/Latino workers are disproportionately \u003ca href=\"https://www.epi.org/blog/black-and-hispanic-workers-are-much-less-likely-to-be-able-to-work-from-home/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleft out\u003c/a\u003e of remote opportunities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEquity:\u003c/strong\u003e The gender pay gap among full-time remote workers has \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90484420/theres-a-massive-pay-gap-between-men-and-women-who-work-from-home?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewidened\u003c/a\u003e over the last six years, according to Owl Labs. And during the pandemic, women have \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/05/08/women-take-on-more-their-kids-remote-learning-responsibilities/5178659002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinued\u003c/a\u003e to shoulder a greater portion of “invisible labor” like childcare, housekeeping, and shopping. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTrust: \u003c/strong\u003eIf employers don’t trust workers to work when they're remote, it can increase burnout and hurt morale. A boom in \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/05/13/854014403/your-boss-is-watching-you-work-from-home-boom-leads-to-more-surveillance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemployee surveillance\u003c/a\u003e, from screen capturing tech to logs of keyboard strokes, has accompanied the recent WFH experiment. Privacy advocates fear this could normalize surveillance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTEvYV9yZWJ1aWx0X2NpdHkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePivoting to remote can be like having a small wedding. You tell people it was for high-minded reasons, but…you probably also saved some $$$. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re not saying your boss doesn’t care about your work-life balance, just that she also cares about not covering your three kombucha/day habit. According to a \u003ca href=\"https://globalworkplaceanalytics.com/telecommuting-statistics?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGlobal Workplace Analytics report\u003c/a\u003e, the typical firm can save an average of $11,000 per half-time telecommuter per year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere do those savings come from? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReal estate and related costs. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRafat Ali, CEO of travel publisher Skift, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.foliomag.com/skift-going-remote-outside-furloughs-staff-news-notes/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Folio\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the firm will save $600,000/year by not renewing the lease on its Manhattan office (it made over $10 million in rev. in 2018). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReduced payroll.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e When Mark Zuckerberg \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/21/facebook-joins-accelerating-trend-toward-permanent-remote-work?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erolled out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Facebook’s new long-term remote policy this month, he indicated that employees who leave Silicon Valley will also bid farewell to their Silicon Valley salaries. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen again, Zuckerberg said Facebook wouldn’t necessarily save money from going more remote because it'll incur other expenses, such as occasionally bringing employees back to HQ for \"onsites.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen again again, he probably knew not to say, “We’re doing this because money.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe research still isn’t 100% conclusive, but there’s some evidence remote work boosts productivity, engagement, and retention, which can indirectly pad companies' bottom lines.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLong Sweatpants, Short the Big Apple\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere are the \u003cem\u003eobvious\u003c/em\u003e consequences of a larger portion of the workforce working from home. Some are less obvious. We compiled a few under-the-radar effects that might not immediately come to mind. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShared workspaces will gain: \u003c/strong\u003eDuring non-pandemic times, don’t expect “remote work” to necessarily mean “work from home.” People will flock to shared workspaces like coffee shops in order to be \u003cem\u003enear \u003c/em\u003eother people while they work—something that hasn’t been a possibility given closures of nonessential businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAthleisure boom\u003c/strong\u003e: The apparel category was growing before the pandemic, but without meetings, offices, or networking events to attend, growth has been supercharged. Shares of athleisure poster child Lululemon \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-21/lululemon-hits-record-on-high-hopes-for-athleisure-trend?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoared\u003c/a\u003e to all-time highs this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGeographic dispersal: \u003c/strong\u003eOffice is gone from midtown NYC? So am I. Expect workers to settle in warmer-weather cities with a lower cost of living. On the employer side, not requiring that workers relocate to a physical office may open up new opportunities to find top talent on the cheap. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eShake-up in podcasting: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen Spotify scooped up Joe Rogan for $100 million, it knew it was gaining more than an audio product—Rogan’s also a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/9/20801873/youtube-podcast-creators-h3-joe-rogan-ethan-klein-hila-david-dobrik-views?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evideo superstar\u003c/a\u003e. With fewer commuters listening to podcasts in cars and trains, we’ll likely see more activity in the audio/video hybrid space Spotify and others are now investing in. \u003cstrong style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMiss Talking About the Weather?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Small talk \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=377 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/5t9tmFbNcGbVVTLRGi/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Small talk \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/5t9tmFbNcGbVVTLRGi/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOscar Wilde \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/feb/20/conversations-last-refuge-the-art-and-heart-of-talking-about-the-weather?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonce dissed\u003c/a\u003e conversations about the weather as “the last refuge of the unimaginative.” But considering idle chit chat around the watercooler all but evaporates in remote work arrangements, it's worth asking: Is there any value in discussing last night's \u003cem\u003eSurvivor \u003c/em\u003eepisode with a coworker? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMany business leaders hail chance conversations as essential\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSilicon Valley can trace its pro-small talk mentality back to Intel, which laid out its workspaces to make sure employees bumped into each other like molecules. According to biographer Walter Isaacson, Steve Jobs \u003ca href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/20141007161621-73685339-why-steve-jobs-obsessed-about-office-design-and-yes-bathroom-locations/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edesigned\u003c/a\u003e Pixar’s HQ with a central “atrium” for gathering—and even positioned the bathrooms to encourage spontaneous employee interaction. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJobs later planned Apple’s new headquarters to consist of a ring of open workspaces surrounding a courtyard.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s the point?\u003c/strong\u003e The argument can be summed up in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marissa-mayer-defends-her-work-from-home-ban-2013-4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2013 memo\u003c/a\u003e sent by Yahoo’s former CEO Marissa Mayer: “People are more collaborative and innovative when they’re together.” She was defending her ban on employees working from home. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCan Slack and Zoom replace small talk?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePossibly. But creating the kind of cross-team rapport you get from impromptu brainstorms and avoiding eye contact in the bathroom mirror is like using a whisk instead of an electric mixer. WFH experts like Stanford professor Nicholas Bloom say it’s definitely possible, but takes effort. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBloom \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2020/3/20/21187469/work-from-home-coronavirus-productivity-mental-health-nicholas-bloom?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Recode\u003c/a\u003e that employees should have the following videoconferences every. single. day: 1) A half-hour group chat to talk about anything and everything \u003cem\u003eexcept\u003c/em\u003e work and 2) 10-minute chats between bosses and direct reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nReflections on Working From Home\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Wayfair Home Office\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84Mzgvd2F5ZmFpcl9ob21lX29mZmljZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wayfair.com/shop-the-look/slp/-foundstone-photo-id449715\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWayfair\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is Neal Freyman, the managing editor of Morning Brew. With our company completely remote since March 11, I thought you might be interested to hear what the experience has been like for the Brew writers.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere’s been no disruption in our day-to-day: \u003c/strong\u003eAll our team \u003cem\u003ereally\u003c/em\u003e needs to write newsletters is a strong wi-fi connection and the steady drip of coffee. Not only have we managed to publish our existing schedule of newsletters without any problem, we’ve added one publication already during the pandemic (\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Essentials\u003c/a\u003e) and are planning to launch another newsletter in a few weeks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut I don’t talk to other teams much. \u003c/strong\u003eI think this is one of the biggest differences between working in an office and WFH—I interact with few others beyond the editorial team and the leadership team. I used to talk to the hilarious folks in our sales department every day when grabbing something from the office refrigerator, but I haven’t spoken to most of them in months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo while things seem to be going smoothly...\u003c/strong\u003eI don’t know what we’re missing out on. Which face-to-face conversations would’ve led to the next big idea? Would morale be higher if our company formed a kickball team? How much better would the Brew’s newsletters be if we could discuss our issues in-person? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eI don’t have the answer. But I, for one, am ready to get back to the office ASAP.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eDisclaimer: The home office in this
